Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel before or after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: evillaManila
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Casa Sant andrea prior to our taking a cruise from Venice. The hotel was perfect for our needs as it is very near the People Mover station for cruise passengers, Piazzale Roma where buses stop, the vaporetto stations and the train station. The rooms may be basic but it was large enough, very clean and comfortable. Since this was an old building, i expected the bathroom to be outdated but it turned out to be newly remodelled and was very large and clean. Breakfast is simple but filling and plentiful. The hotel could however improve the lighting in the stair landing. Also, the elevator which could be used only for luggages, was a bit difficult to operate. Staff however were available to help you out. In all, i would recommend this hotel especially for people who are looking for a short stay in Venice prior or after taking a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Room with character”
Reviews.Author: SurreyDoris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room was a good size with large bathroom. We had a double and single bed in the room. The only thing was the wardrobes separated the room so we were separated and couldn't lay in bed chatting. It was nice to see the original beams and exposed brickwork. The room was very warm. The breakfast was ample and replenished all the time. The staff were very helpful and room cleaned daily with clean towels. We took the bus from the aiport and the hotel was quite easy to find from the bus station. The water bus stop was just around the corner from the hotel, this took you to St Marks Square and other stops en route. The main station is about 5 mins walk which is very handy when moving on to next location. We booked a walking tour and gondola ride (separate) in advance of travel. This saved wasting time when we got there, not sure if it saved money. The gondola ride was worth every penny (just under Â£100 for the 3 of us). Make sure you have comfy shoes on, a rain mac was advisable whilst we were there. Plenty of places to stop off for food/drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality 2 * hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SaraJWorcester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in this 2 * hotel in a double room for 3 nights in April 2012. First impressions of the room were that it was quite small but it was comfortable and impeccably clean. Ideal for a couple planning to use it as a base, as we did....we were up early and back late to make the most of our time in Venice. It was about a 15 minute walk to San Marco and very accessible to many restaurants. It was also nice and quiet despite being behind a bus station. There is Wi Fi available as well. Breakfast was fairly basic (continental style), but adequate for our needs as it's a must to sample the local delicacies as you explore this wonderful city! (Save money for your visitor tax upon check out, adaptor with extension lead would come in handy for charging phones, cameras etc.). We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: shedevil49
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the bathroom was huge , the bedroom was great , location brilliant. I agree the breakfast could be better a bit of fruit would be nice

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality for a 2-star accomodation”
Reviews.Author: DavideTorino79
Reviews.Content: This 2-star hotel offers a very good quality/price ratio. My room was basic but comfortable and clean. The hotel is close to the train station (it takes 5 minutes on foot); you have a ferry stop to Murano on your doorstep and just round the corner (Piazzale Roma) you can get on ferry boats to the city centre. Breakfast is good. The staff was kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Worth The Stay”
Reviews.Author: exe1
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting luxuary this is not the hotel for you however, if you want a cheap comfortable nice hotel then you should look no further than this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was nice and comfortable and clean, beds were comfortable, bathroom was good, room was warm. Breakfast was basic but nice and filling Very close to a major water taxi stop and bus station for the mainland, rail stn is also in walking distance. All in all this is a good base for someone wanting to explore Venice

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, brilliant stay but not so happy about the staff..”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, clean and rather spacey. The food was quite nice/average. Very good location as it is a couple of minutes walk from Piazzale Roma, the Grand Canal and the cruise boat docks. Our view was out the front, we watched The Tourist one night on a cruise boat's huge screen :D The staff were not very helpful though and seemed grumpy, but not rude, I think it is just their way. Their English was not good either, but my Italian is worse.So don't let this put you off, it was an amazing building, looks a little rough on the outside, but nicely updated inside. Good value + good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for the marathon”
Reviews.Author: LuLuHade
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but I just wanted to share my experience to assist other travellers. The reason for my trip to Venice was to participate in the marathon. I was looking for a relatively cheap hotel to spend a couple of nights- I did not expect much. To make this review short and sweet I would recommend this hotel for price and location, however, there were a couple of things that made my stay unpleasant. My issues were related to 1) the lack of hot water and 2) the room temperature. 1) My daily shower is a very important to me as it sets me up for the day. The morning of the marathon I woke up at 6.30 am and there was no hot water and therefore I had a cold start to the day. When I returned from the marathon later that day there was no hot water again. I called reception who said that they would fix the issue. I then waited 40 minutes, longer than the 10 minutes that I was told to wait, and tested the water to find that it was still cold. After raising the issue again with reception I ended up showering in a room on another floor. The hotel was not too apologetic. 2)The room was cold no matter how high we had the heating and when I requested another blanket I was told that it wasn't possible as the hotel was full. I spent the night before the marathon a little restless and cold- not the best start after waking up early that morning to catch a flight from London to Venice. To be fair the hotel did supply an extra blanket the second night however again I felt like my request was an inconvenience to the staff member. In conclusion, there were good points about the hotel, price, location, breakfast however I think they should expect to provide hot water as a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place for location and value, not glamor”
Reviews.Author: mistry11
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for it's location to the cruise port and it was only a 5 minute walk from Piazzala Roma, which is where the buses from the airport bring you. It was also moderately priced. That said, the hotel was clean and quiet. The rooms were not american sized, but larger than other European hotels I've stayed in. The breakfast was basic but more than sufficient. The one thing that really bothered me was that the air conditioning seemed to do almost nothing for the room. Unfortunately we arrived during a hot spell and the room was uncomfortablly hot. Called the front desk and they couldn't do anything so we asked for a fan, which they did deliver. This hotel is also quite convenient to multiple vaparetto lines and the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Other than the location- It's not great”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Sant'Andrea for 1 night. The location is great. Less than 10 minutes walk from the train station and right around the corner from the Vaparetto stops and a local supermarket. For some STRANGE/STUPID reason all hotel guests are given keys to the bathroom on their floor...what is the point? A guest who shared a bathroom with us used his key to open the bathroom door that was CLEARLY locked and walked in on my boyfriend doing his business. Upon complaining to the receptionist he said he could only tell them not to do it.... and then it happened again!! I can understand it's not the hotels fault that the guest kept using his key to use the bathroom then lock it when he was finished- so we never knew if someone was actually in there but what is the point of a key for the bathroom??? If it's locked it's obviously in use!! Breakfast was average. Lady on reception is rude...Ok for 1 night but we won't be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel For Your Cruise Pit Stop”
Reviews.Author: de_lymer
Reviews.Content: Casa Santâ€™Andrea was ideal for our one night stay before heading to our cruise ship the following morning. We arrived at Marco Polo Airport around 10:30pm and managed to hop aboard the express ATVO Fly Bus to Piazzale Roma, which was directly in front of the Arrivals Terminal. It took approx. 30 mins and cost â‚¬5 each. You can buy your tickets at either the ticket counter located within the airport or from the bus driver. The hotel was a convenient 3 min walk from the Piazzale Roma - no bridges to cross. We walked along the side of the People Mover station which led to the canal on which the hotel is located. As you enter the foyer you truly appreciate the age of the building which has been well maintained with its stone walls and aged marble steps. The receptionist at the counter was cordial and told us that our room was located on the second floor. Unfortunaltely, we had to take the stairs with our heavy luggage as the lift was locked. The building is vast â€“ which is deceiving from the outside â€“ and there was quite a bit of searching for those sensor lights as we when through the corridors. Our room was small and basic with no TV but clean which was sufficient for our one night. The bathroom was a very good size with a great shower and loads of towels and toiletries. I have to say the best thing was the view from the bathroom window which faced directly towards the Marittima Cruise Ship Terminal where we could see our ship in the distance. Breakfast was a basic continental and coffee was served by a very pleasant gentleman in the main dining room. With its exposed wooden beans you can truly feel the history here. The hotel is ideally situated close to a water taxi stop and it was just lovely to sit along the canal in front of the hotel and watch the boats go by. At checkout we were able to leave our bags as we decided to a take a few hours to explore Venice before jumping on the People Mover (â‚¬1 each) for the ship. Please note that while our bags were at the hotel we took a little trek part of the way to the Cruise Ship Terminal and it was quite a walk over various terrain. The People Mover is well worth the price. Overall, Casa Santâ€™Andrea is a perfect hotel for an overnight stay if you just want a place to rest your head before your exciting cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the star rating- stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jwlsTrentham
Reviews.Content: We were staying for one night only and chose the Casa Sant' Andrea because it was cheap and close to the port. We weren't expecting a great deal but, as long as you remember that the hotel is at the budget end you will not be disappointed. This place doesn't have views of St Marks Square, the rooms are not luxurious and they don't have 40 inch screen TVs but do you really go to Venice to stay in your hotel? We booked a quad room. What we got were adjoining rooms (101 and 102) with a large en-suite. The room was spotless, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was good and the air con efficient. The towels weren't thick and fluffy but the were lots of them. The staff , who spoke English,were accommodating- our room was ready and checking in early was no problem. Other visitors who arrived well before check-in time were allowed to leave their bags, Similarly the hotel was fine about us leaving our bags in reception after we checked out. The building itself is pleasant and they have left some interesting original features in place. Breakfast is plain and simple but plentiful-we enjoyed it If like us, you are staying in Venice prior to joining a cruise this place is in an ideal situation. Get the direct bus from Marco Polo- it costs 5 euros, buy tickets before you leave the airport- the hotel is three minutes easy walk away from the stop (another reviewer gives good directions). The highly efficient people carrier costs 1 euro and takes you to the port. . We spent the day in Venice and found our way round pretty easily, The city isn't that big and there are signs on the walls giving you directions to the major attractions. However I did get lost looking for the Coop near to the hotel. It's great if you want to buy a good cold beer- prices in bars and restaurants can be high. To find it leave the hotel and walk back to the bus station. On the far side of the bus station is the canal. There is a large modern foot bridge over the canal. Make your way to the bridge but don't cross it. Go down the broad flight of steps to the left- there are a number of stops for vaperreto in front of you -take a left and walk alongside the canal for about a hundred metres- the coop is the last building you get to. It is quite large and fairly cheap. A good stop- I'll use Casa Sant Andrea again

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: DSpad
Reviews.Content: Casa Sant'Andrea was great value for a hotel on the island of Venice! It was basic but comfortable, in a quiet area on a canal. Breakfast was good also. We were staying only for a night before our cruise, and it worked out well for us. The location was the best part for us, a short walk from Piazzale Roma where you can take the vaporetti (water buses) anywhere around Venice. Good value for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Cruise Ship Passengers”
Reviews.Author: heavylunch
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on price and location. We were not disappointed. We were able to take an express bus from the airport to Piazalle Roma the main bus terminal in this part of Venice. It was a 5 min walk to the hotel. We dropped our luggage off, then a 5 min walk back to the Grand Canal. There is also a water taxi station right outside the hotel and near Piazalle Roma. There was also a COOP grocery store between the hotel and the pz Roma Taxi station. We were able pick up water/ snacks for the day of sight seeing. The rooms were comfortable european style rooms. No safe box in the room but the hotel in gerenal seemed very safe. At breakfast they served hot chocolate which was wonderful. The rest of the breakfast was adequate but nothing special. Finally when it came time to get to the cruise ship, the hotel is conviently located right by the "People Mover" or tram. For just 1 Euro the tram took you right to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for cruise ship travel”
Reviews.Author: veniceMed2011
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. It is clean, inexpensive, quiet, and located near ideal transportation for getting to and from Venice airport and cruise ships. The personnel speak English. A big plus is that we were able to get to the hotel without having to use steps (a miracle in Venice). We had separate rooms with a shared, modern bath. The breakfast provided was great; however, I did not drink the orange juice since reviews had warned that it was mediocre. The only possible negative(for some, not us) is that the rooms did not have TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value basic base in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Cropton100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less than 10 mins walk from railway station and 5 mins to bus station and a main vaporetta stop, the facilites are basic but is clean with hot water - I personally don't ask for much more! Breakfast was basic but OK for the price paid in central Venice - I don't think you would fare this well in central London! It was very quiet and felt very safe and secure. The staff were helpful and there was no problem leaving bags at end of stay. Getting around Venice seems extremely confusing at first but would recommend a travel card (is purchased by time) so found buying a ticket valid for 36hours at 23 euros was brilliant value - very convenient and you have the freedom of hopping on and off wherever you choose.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel / Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Lightning_Trip
Reviews.Content: Bit of a hidden gem this one. Getting there you do go past some back paths in Venice, but it is ever so close to the train station and the water bus stops. Helpful staff, Clean room. The bathroom was separate (we chose this) but was a very large bathroom and clean, not the usual shower shared rooms - but a whole room just outside the bedroom and requiring the room key to open. The building itself is very big inside, looks like they could do more with the place. Venice was great!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Bus, Train, Water Buses and Cruises”
Reviews.Author: Realityracer
Reviews.Content: Near to Piazzale Roma. Basic comfortable rooms in old refurbished monastery with no passsenger lift. Ok continental breakfast. Great for 1 night stays due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: tutes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money in terms of location,cleanliness and friendly staff.It is easy to get to from both the bus station and the vaporetti stop.It is quiet and very clean with really helpful and friendly staff.The rooms are basic and if you get an inside room as we did ,you look out onto a roof!However,for the price it is fine.The breakfast is not very exciting-just cereal,yoghurt and bread-no ham or eggs.Next door is a church,whose bells ring out every morning at 8o'clock-but we were usually awake then anyway!We would definitely recommend it for a short stay-not really for a longer stay when you would want a balcony and a bit more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: karen56Durham
Reviews.Content: I was dreading my stay for one night at this hotel - I read some reviews on Tripadvisor after booking though another website. I'm not sure what people expect from a 2 star hotel but this was better than I'd anticipated. At breakfast there was a choice of fresh rolls, cheese, jams etc and freshly made drinks. We were served by an extremely pleasant lady. The hotel was spotless, the bathroom quite large, we found the staff to be pleasant and courteous, and it is very convenient to the station and Piazzale Roma. I would definitely stay there again if I were looking for a 2 star hotel, the price (for Venice) was excellent. The only minor point was the problem with the drinks vending machine, which did not register the coins correctly so we ended up paying double the amount for a bottle of water. The duty manager wasn't overlly helpful over this - maybe due to language limitations? A very minor point though. Contrary to other reviews we found this hotel to be very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Well-Priced Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dobedoda
Reviews.Content: The Casa Sant'Andrea is a nice, well-priced, basic hotel. I would stay at the hotel again; however, I'll have different expectations next time. The hotel is located eight minutes from Piazzale Roma (measured while dragging luggage). We arrived carrying two heavy suite cases. Having a room two floors above, I asked about an elevator. After getting a "no", I lugged them up two long flights of stairs. It wasn't until later that I discovered they had a luggage elevator (it would have been nice if they had volunteered that information). The room was large with a comfortable bed. The breakfast was classic continental: hard white rolls, packaged croissants, watered-down orange drink and coffee or tea. The coffee and tea were the best parts of the breakfast. Both individuals I dealt with at the reception desk were experts at ignoring you while you're standing in front of the desk. Once you got their attention, they were cordial. The Google map slightly mis-locates the hotel. It is actually located on a canal slightly to the west of the Ponte della Liberta road bridge. With its location, the hotel is a little off the "beaten path"; such that I felt uncomfortable walking to it at midnight (through an underpass, past dumpsters, dim lighting). Once inside the hotel at night, we had to walk up large, wide staircases and reception halls that were also poorly lit (many of the motion detectors were poorly situated).

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location for Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Hamstring
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night prior to departing for our cruise. We chose the hotel to be near the port and that it was. From a location point of view it is also near the Piazza Del Roma which is where the bus station is and one of the main vaperetto stops. The hote is a converted monastery. Our room was large, with a very large bathroom and although immaculately tidy we fel the decor was cold but the decor was cold and the room had a hospital feel about it. The bed was hard and not the most comforatble. Be warned the church next door's bell will ring and wake you up!!! Plus theere is ongong works nearby on a new train line (mono rail). The breakfast was very basic with come watery juice, tea/coffee and some small toast in a wrapper offering or a croissant. The staff were fine if a little distant. Location wise it was fine for the cruise & to get quickly to the bus station, however we were glad we were only staying there for one night and would not recommend it for a stay of any great length.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but check the room configuration in advance”
Reviews.Author: EnglishLizzie999
Reviews.Content: The Casa Sant'Andrea was an interesting hotel that had been converted from an old monastery. It was in a good location - right near the bus and train stations - also 5 minutes from the vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal from where you can jump on a vaporetto to go anywhere in Venice. Also has a large supermarket next to the vaporetto stands which is useful for cheap supplies - water, cold beer or even picnic supplies to keep costs down! The hotel was spotlessly clean and good value. My only criticism is that 3 months in advance we booked and paid for a double room fo 3 3 nights (with gta hotels) but on arrival were given a twin room and told there was no double available. We were only given a double on the last night when we had complained each day. If you read the small print in the gta booking conditions they do not guarantee you will get the type of room you booked - indeed they say if you book a twin you may be given a double on arrival! So if you particulary wish a double or twin I would suggest contacting the hotel in advance to make your requirements clear.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and lovely surroundings! Great travel links!”
Reviews.Author: popz1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a uni trip, and was not expecting much as this hotel is 2 star. However we were pleasantly suprised. The hotel is in a 16th century monestary and has some great original features such as a conference/meeting room with an original beamed ceiling and chandelier! The room my friend and I shared was excellent, It was really two single bedrooms with a shared bathroom and small corridor area in the middle, which was lovely as you could have privacy or leave the doors open! There is a heater in each room (which I took full advantage of as it is cold and rainy in Venice in January!) And shuttered windows which open right up for ventelation and great views! The bathroom was modern and very clean with a spacious cabinate for storage, which is unusual in most hotels. The storage in the rooms themselves was excellent with massive wardrobes and a desk with a drawer and chair. The beds were comforable enough and the bedding/towls were clean. The staff in the hotel were friendly as far as Venicians go, but did not speak much english (which seems to be the trend in Venice...) There was a complementry breakfast from 7-10 which was nice enough, croissants, bread rolls, spreads and jams, and a hot drink of your choice served at the table. The rolls come in very handy to sneak away for lunch! The location of this hotel cannot be faulted, you are around the corner from the main boat stop with links to all of the city and islands. Around another corner from the coach station, which is handy for getting to and from the airport/mainland. There is a co-op supermarket by the side of the hotel and a brand new stylish bridge links you to a lovely street full of resturaunts, bars and shops! The only down side to this hotel is that the lift was not working while we were there, but the hardly effects all the possitive points! I would definitely reccomend this hotel for anyone wanting a cheaper than average stay in Venice, but still after nice surroundings and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place if you want kind, caring service...”
Reviews.Author: civismundi
Reviews.Content: If you want excellent service and a clean, well-run hotel, this is your place in Venice. It used to be a monastery and retains much historical charm. It is near the train station and a two-minute walk from Piazzale Roma. The manager is absolutely superb and caring by any standard and personally helps his clientele with travel and other arrangements. This is a simple, lovely, very very good bargain. Cannot be recommended highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Away-day in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AJS2008
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a hot Malta to a very chilly Venice!The hotel Casa Sant'Andrea was 2-3 minutes walk from the bus station and on the banks of S.Chiara Canal, it was very clean throughout, the room was basic (as expected, no TV or kettle)with a spacious, clean and well appointed ensuite bathroom. Breakfast was the standard continental type, perfectly adequate and the receptionists were very friendly and helpful (we didn't meet any other staff). The Bed. The bed was the downfall of the whole holiday, I have never heard such a noisy, squeaky bed - it squeaked if you breathed too hard, and turning over was out of the question! After the second night I suffered terribly with by back all the following day, but I do have a sensitive back. Venice itself was lovely, wandering down the narrow streets and across the different types of bridges. The architecture of the myriad churches and old buildings was really something although, unless you intend to visit all the museums and interiors of buildings open to the public, one day was quite enough for us. We did walk miles and covered well over half of Venice, although I think maybe at this time of year there may be less to see as we only saw two street markets, which are fascinating, and I think there may be a lot more earlier in the year when the weather is better. It is ludicrously expensive for takeaway food and for drinks, we like a quite drink in the evening but it cost â‚¬3.50 for a 330ml can of lager in the cafe bars which were not really set up for people to just sit and have a drink and restaurants were the only other alternative. Our hotel did have a vending machine with 330ml cans of Tuborg for just â‚¬1.20 but that wasn't quite the same. There are seemingly hundreds of gift shops which we thought were, on the whole, very reasonable. Another thing to note is that it costs â‚¬1 to spend a penny in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price, but a little far from the main area”
Reviews.Author: kimdv1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at Casa Sant'Andrea in August 2007. I had a room with a private bed and private bathroom, paid about 55 euros which included a simple breakfast. Booking: I contacted the hotel directly via email, to which Ezio responded promptly, answering any questions I may have had. They accept credit cards, and hold reservations without needing the number. They even changed the reservation for me a few days before I arrived since my plans have to be rearranged. Area: Decent area - seemingly a bit shady. You either take a ferry taxi 1 stop from the train station, or walk through 3 or 4 mini bridges. I'd estimate 10 minute fast walk, 20 minute walk with luggage. Far from the main area - wasn't quite ideal for me in the end. Literally had to walk 25 minutes down one direction before hitting the square. Accommodations: Very cozy. Good bed, clean, comfortable. Lovely bathrooms (after shlepping through Europe, it was MUCH appreciated!) It was a bit odd - my room door opened to stairs, so I'd have to walk down the stairs to get to my bed. Internet available next to the front desk - I believe they charge a few euros per hour. Breakfast was bleh. It was a cold croissant in a plastic wrapper, with some coffee/tea available. Not much else. No elevator available (at least not while I was there). Hallways were almost pitch black when I was there. Had to feel my way around to find my room. Summary: I might be biased because it's Venice, and hey - what the hell, you know? But I enjoyed my stay at Casa Sant'Andrea. As shady as I thought it might be, it was pleasant and comfortable, if not a bit far from the central attractions. I'd still stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but hotel too noisy”
Reviews.Author: dobedobedo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2008. The hotel was very clean throughout, our bedroom and bathroom were spacious and while breakfast was very basic (as explained in previous reviews) it was OK given the room rate (about Â£20 pppn inc breakfast). The only drawback, as outlined in the previous review, was the noise from adjoining bedrooms/corridor, particularly at night. And unfortunately this would be enough to put us off staying at the hotel again (which is a pity given all the other plus points).

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Alanxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be so good !!! The staff are very good and the rooms are spacious for Venice.It is also very quite OUTSIDE the hotel.Unfortunately the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything in the next room and the corridors.Having no carpets makes the sound travel and we heard every door closing in the corridor and everything in the next room even though they were speaking in a normal voice.We had at least two tour groups visiting whilst we were there including a group of 50 Lithuanians who arrived at midnight and left at 5.30am.You can imagine the noise they made.We also had another night when the couple next door were discussing their trip to Murano....at 4.30 am !!!!!! The breakfast is quite poor as mentioned by previous reviews. All in all you need industrial strength earplugs if you want to guarantee a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_boy1969
Reviews.Content: I have had the privilege of staying on two different occassions at this hotel. It is simply the best value for money hotel I have stayed. The place is spotlessly clean, the people there are genuinely friendly. The rooms have enough space whether you book single or a twin (i've done both). I have had the best experience and I am here looking at booking another room for mid 2008. Can't wait to go back.... I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: clarabellagray
Reviews.Content: We knew that finding a cost effective honeymoon break in Venice at the height of the tourist season would not be easy. We booked our stay at the Casa Sant'Andrea with Bargainholidays.com and after reading some of the previous reviews on here I started to worry that we would be without an ensuite bathroom. I attempted to ease my worry by contacting Bargainholidays who informed me that they only sell rooms that are ensuite from the Casa Sant'Andrea. I was relieved when we arrived to find that this was indeed the case. Once we arrived at Marco Polo airport we managed to find where we could buy tickets for the number 5 bus to take us to Central Venice. At a very reasonable 2euro per person, I recommend this in comparison to the rather expensive taxi boats. The Casa Sant'Andrea is about a two minute walk from where the number 5 bus stops at the Piazalle Roma. It sits just on the outside of the main tourist area - close enough for all the action and quiet enough to get a good nights sleep! The rooms are basic, with no TV etc, but they are clean and tasteful and our bathroom was pleasently spacious. The breakast was exactly as described on other reviews - packet croissants and not much else, what you would expect from accomodation of this price range. All of the staff we met were pleasent and helpful and were always willing to speak english. Overall, a very good option for a break in Venice, especially if you value peace and quiet as much as tourist hustle and bussle.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Sant'Andrea
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 495/b, 30135 Venice, Italy
